summary: Add a dedicated CountWorkflowExecutions API to count workflows instead of relying on the listWorkflowExecutions paginator. This is a separate API call that needs to be exposed as a distinct endpoint in the PHP SDK.
userImpact: Users need an efficient way to count workflows without iterating through paginated results, improving query performance and API usability.
rootCause: The paginator approach for counting workflows is insufficient; a dedicated CountWorkflowExecutions API call is needed as a separate endpoint.
proposedFix: Expose CountWorkflowExecutions as a separate API endpoint in the PHP SDK, potentially supporting more than just integer responses.
workaround: Use listWorkflowExecutions paginator to manually count workflows, though this is inefficient.
resolutionDetails: The feature was implemented and made available in the 2.6 release with CountWorkflowExecutions as a separate API endpoint.
keyQuote: The paginator isn't good enough I don't think, this is a separate `CountWorkflowExecutions` API call.
